content: The potential response "yeah i heard about that ! i wonder how bad that concert must have been" is highly engaging for several reasons. Firstly, it shows a natural curiosity and interest in the topic being discussed, which is always a great way to keep a conversation going. Secondly, it invites further discussion by prompting the other person to share their own thoughts or experiences, which can lead to a deeper and more meaningful conversation. Lastly, it injects a bit of humor into the conversation, which can lighten the mood and make the interaction more enjoyable for everyone involved. In short, this response is engaging because it is curious, open-ended, and humorous, all of which are key ingredients for a successful conversation.

: While I can see why the affirmative side might view this response as engaging, I believe it falls short in a few key ways. Firstly, it does not offer any new information or insights that could move the conversation forward. Instead, it simply reiterates what was already said, which can make the conversation feel stagnant or repetitive. Additionally, the attempt at humor might not be well-received by everyone, and could potentially come across as insensitive given the context of the conversation. Lastly, while it does invite further discussion, it does so in a somewhat generic and uncreative way, which might not be enough to keep the conversation going. Overall, I do not believe this response is as engaging as the affirmative side suggests, and could benefit from more substance and thoughtfulness.

[Rebuttal] I respectfully disagree with the negative side's assessment of the potential response. While it is true that the response does not offer new information or insights, it does not necessarily mean that it falls short in engagingness. Sometimes, in a conversation, it's not about providing new information, but rather showing interest and curiosity in what the other person is saying. This response does precisely that, by expressing genuine curiosity about the bad Creed concert and inviting the other person to share their thoughts on the matter. Additionally, while humor can be subjective, in this case, it is not insensitive or inappropriate, as it's merely a lighthearted comment on how bad the concert must have been. Lastly, while the response may not be overly creative, it is still effective in keeping the conversation going, as it prompts the other person to share their thoughts and experiences about bad concerts they may have attended. Therefore, I believe that this response is still highly engaging and serves as an excellent example of how to keep a conversation flowing naturally.

: While I understand and appreciate the affirmative side's perspective, I still maintain that the potential response falls short in engagingness. While showing interest and curiosity in what the other person is saying is undoubtedly important in a conversation, it is not enough on its own to make a response engaging. Engagingness requires a bit more creativity and substance, which this response lacks. Lastly, while the response may prompt the other person to share their thoughts on bad concerts, it does so in a way that feels predictable and uninspired. Overall, while the potential response is not terrible, it is not particularly engaging either, and could benefit from more creativity and thoughtfulness.

[Rebuttal] I appreciate the negative side's continued input, but I must respectfully disagree once again. While it is true that engagingness requires creativity and substance, it is also important to recognize that conversations can be engaging in different ways. topic_chat_history:
so , i 'm reading the latest film from studio ghibli is out the tale of princess kaguya . dunno if you 're familiar with them , but studio ghibli has made a lot of great animated films , like spirited away , and princess mononoke 
 i do n't think i have heard of them . i have heard that one of the directors recently passed away , and his last film was nominated for an academy award 
 yeah , sadly , disney ( which owns the american rights to the films ) does n't tend to promote them very much . i think they 're worried they 'll cut into their " home grown " market . anyway , dunno if you even like animated movies , but they 're worth checking out . 
 i do n't watch them very often . apparently there was a showing of the recent film in a park in d.c . that 's one u.s . city i have n't been to 
 sadly , i have n't been to dc either , although i 've always wanted to visit there . apparently there 's a lot of interesting going down this summer . they 're having a crab feast at the navy - marine corps stadium . they 'll have 100 gallons of crab soup ! can you imagine that much soup ? 
 i recently met a girl who lives in that area , and she said the nightlife is worth visiting for . it sounds like many of the events feature jazz music . do you listen to jazz very often ? 
 a little bit , i 'm not too familiar with it . i know is originated in new orleans and a little bit about the history , but that 's about it . heard clint eastwood is a big jazz fan , thought that was pretty interesting .. 
 there 's many different styles , probably derived from the various regions in the us where it has taken root . kansas city is another place where it has prominence 
 you know there 's a programming language in which programs are written in musical composition , and so the programs have jazz - like harmonies . as a computer guy , i find that pretty fascinating . so , you ever been to a live concert ? ( jazz or otherwise ? ) 
 that is interesting . i have n't been to a live concert recently , but i want to many when i was younger . most of them were in smaller venues though . 
 it 's been awhile since i 've been to any as well . got a friend of mine he 's big into the ramones and seen them in concert a few times . get this , they 've played a total of 2,263 concerts , touring almost non - stop for over twenty years . now that 's dedication to your music ! 
 i can only imagine how exhausting that must be as well . sometimes i think it would be cool to travel to some of the ancient amphitheaters to see what they 're like . pink floyd once recorded a live concert with no audience in a roman one in pompeii 
 wonder why the did it without an audience ? pretty sure people would have shown if they 're heard about it . must be one of those " eccentric rock and roll musician " things . wonder how a concert would sound held in an old amphitheater ... 
 it might be because an audience would affect the sound and acoustics in the theater . there 's another ancient amphitheater in croatia that 's used for concerts . those romans really liked their theaters 
 well , theaters were a big event at the time , plays , gladiator events , concerts .. you got ta remember , they did n't have the internet back then , so they had to do something for entertainment . :) so , what was the last concert you ever attended ? 
 now that i think about it , i went to one a little over a year ago around christmastime , so most of the songs were christmas songs . the venue was fairly big , but not as big as ones like where the big name artists perform . it was good still , unlike the 2002 creed concert that was bad enough for concert goers to file a lawsuit
topic_chat_fact: in 2002 a creed concert was so bad that four concert goers filed a lawsuit against the band
topic_chat_response: yeah i heard about that ! i wonder how bad that concert must have been .
